pullRequest.body:
Also removes an `autoImplicit` that tripped me up when working on this file.

---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7240733936/job/19724050678)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7240733936/job/19724050850)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7240733936/job/19724050598)

```suggestion
theorem isMulCentral_commute [Mul G] {a : G} {b : k} (ha : IsMulCentral a) (hb : IsMulCentral b) :
    IsMulCentral (single a b) :=
```
Annoyingly, this comes with associativity obligations, so maybe make the above a separate lemma and instead change this one to
```suggestion
theorem forall_commute_single [Mul G] {a : G} {b : k} (ha : âˆ€ a', Commute a a') (hb : âˆ€ b', Commute b b') :
    âˆ€ f : MonoidAlgebra k G, Commute (single a b) f :=
```
The `center` version requires some prework that I'd rather leave to another PR; #6993 is blocked by this PR, and doesn't care about non-associative rings.

```suggestion
theorem forall_commute_of [MulOneClass G] {a : G} (h : âˆ€ a', Commute a a') (f : MonoidAlgebra k G) :
    Commute (of k G a) f :=
```
so that the `of` is visibly **not** a lemma name connective
I don't agree with these renames, there is already precedence in this file for `of` being used in this way, and `forall` is a meaningless prefix on most lemmas, since they all use a `forall`.

```suggestion
theorem forall_commute_of' [Semiring k] [AddZeroClass G] {a : G} (h : âˆ€ a', AddCommute a a')
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/MonoidAlgebra): when `single` and `of` commute
